Because of th at, this paper aims to study the behavior of this molecule in the exci ted state by investigatin g the vertical excitations for silol e and dimethyl silole, characterizing and analyzing the excited states along the ring puckering coordinate . The same was done for furan and thiophene molecules (E0 ring puckering form ) to compai r with sil ole. For this w as used the equation -of-motion coupled cluster s ingles and doubles method (EOM -CCSD) with aug-cc-pVTZ base function implemented in the MOLPRO pac kage. The distortions were made from the optimized initial geometry. From the potential energy surfaces of the silol e can be highlight ed the presence of a first excited state with great distortion tendencies, it has little energy variation even suffering a great distortion in its equilibrium geometry. Also the possibility of crossing with the ground state in the form 1E (4E) for very distorted molecules . ğ‘†2 âˆ’ğ‘†3 intersections are also observed for surfaces in the 0E and 1E forms at amplitudes above 25 Â° involving ğœâˆ’ ğœ‹âˆ— transitions, differing from the other molecules in the series.
